page.title: 03The Bird Life Of Papa Stour
page.content: Papa Stour has a great variety of birds : many of these are sea birds.The cliffs are home to Fulmars, Kittiwakes, Shags, Cormorants and Guillemots. We have the largest nesting population of {Artic Terns}(shetland name-Tirricks) in Great Britain. The Tirrick flies farther than any other bird, because it goes to the Antarctic for the winter.They are very noisy little birds and defend their nesting sites by dive-bombing intruders ! We also have many{ Ringed Plovers {(Sandy Loos) which flutter}around the sea-shore. Another summer visitor is a handsome "pirate" with a rather nasty habit. The {Arctic Skua}(Skutie Alun) chases sea birds in dynamic flight ,forcing them to disgorge their fishy dinners -which it then eats!
